text: Permissions question: Do you need to be a super admin on an account to use this feature? I don't see anything in the CMS React docs spelling this out, but I can't add Developer Projects to my PAK scopes and I can't figure out what to tell my admin to add to my permission set to get access. I'd rather not give all devs in the org super admin access, but I just wanted to know if that's necessary.
Yes, you will need to be a super-admin to upload CMS-React projects.
If it helps: we’re using Github actions to upload to HubSpot so we have one account with super-admin and its credentials are used in GH action secrets to actually upload projects and themes.
Not ideal for a variety of reasons but it’s the best compromise for us at the moment.
Thanks! Actually the github actions thing might come in really handy negotiating with the admin folks. Appreciate that.
Using Graphql for your react components is only available on Content Hub Pro+? The client has CRM Suite pro. Would it be possible then?

Ok wait, important question before I am really screwed and hopefully there is actually someone from HubSpot over here. The client is on the CRM Suite Pro plan. Would it be even possible to use React for them or should everything be made with Hubl??!!! Because from what I read here its only for Sales and Service Enterprise

Mentioning <@UAYBXDG4U> Since it’s quite important before I move forward.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/developer-projects-setup>
CMS React is available for all tiers of the CMS, including free.
You will however, not be able to make use of _other_ features built on developer projects - i.e. Private and Public Apps, UI Card Extensions etc.
Ok great! That a relieve.. But using Graphql as a data fetching method would be only possible for enterprise accounts, right? Then will use hubl methods for now
GraphQL is scoped to enterprise as is documented.

Hi there folks. Does anyone know how I can trigger a serverless function locally using this server `hs-cms-dev-server`  - It seems like it creates a proxy at `<http://hslocal.net>` which keeps wanting to route it to HubSpot under `/hs/serverless/*` instead of my local version  — error is always `attempting to proxy a GET serverless request to domain: <http://subdomain.HubSpotpagebuilder.com|subdomain.HubSpotpagebuilder.com> for resource: /hs/serverless/parrot?message=kool`
